page.title: 06FRILSHAM-MARLSTON LIFESTYLES
page.content: Marlston lies south of Frilsham. It is really a hamlet and is the centre of the{Marlston estate}which belonged to the{Palmer family}who owned all the land thereabouts. Its name was first recorded as{Martels Manor.}It is much smaller than Frilsham. Round the church in the grounds of what was Marlston Manor are the cottages once lived in by the{estate workers}and now separately sold off. Many workers are buried in the churchyard and also commemorated in the church. In the old days{girls}went from school to work at the Manorhouse or Hawkridge House till they{married the men}who worked on the farms all their lives. Now there are few domestics or farm workers. The little Norman church of Saint Mary is now a parish church where where Brockhurst School boys sing in the choir.
